answers.answer: I didn't know moving around had any effect on pre eclampsia. my water broke at 36 Weeks and i found out at the hospital that i had pre eclampsia. But i was active and just moving around like any other day. My feet were pretty swollen, I don't think it made things worse. But you should get your doctors opinion.

Thats exactly what happened to me. i went in monday at 38 weeks 1day and my dr told me i had mild preeclampsia and he induced me that day at 4:30. Got to the hospital so they put they catheter balloon in my cervix to help ripen. 23 hrs of labor and couldnt get passed a 6 so they made me get c section. turns out my baby had his cord wrapped 3 times around his neck so theres no way i was gonn have natural birth (unfortunately :() but had him yesterday at 5 pounds 11 oz and hes perfection :)

question: Okay, so just recently I was diagnosed with mild preeclampsia and told to be on light bedrest. I have been pregnant many times before but unfortunately this pregnancy has been the worst. I am almost 38 weeks on Sunday and just really want to have this baby and get things started. If my ankles are swollen, can I still walk alot to move things along? My appointment is tomorrow with my OB as well as an appointment at the hospital for fetal monitoring again and I take public transportation so I know I'm goin to have to be on my feet alot. I just don't want to do anything that might harm the baby or myself.
title: Worried and impatient
